video_description: GM made this awesome ad spot for the Olympics that uses Brandi Carlile's "The Story." I love the lyric "I was made for you." So beautiful.
title: "I was made for you" Olympics GM Commerical with Brandi Carlile

comments.text:
Makes me sad, General Motors has broken my heart for the last time. 

1984 Chevy Silverado (Sold and still running)

2002 GMC Sonoma (wrecked)

comments.text:
All this ridiculous american hype is mental. I just looked at the Paris motor show and checked out what GM presents.

Chevrolet Cruze made by Suzuki in Japan. Same car as the shitty Lacetti.

Equinox is Canadian.

Captiva = korean Daewo Windstorm.

Chevrolet Spark = Daewo Matiz

Chevrolet Aveo = Daewo Kalos.

What is it about this﻿ korean plastic that is worthy of your diehard patriotism ? They are never touched by american hands. infact.. does america make anything except pickup trucks ?

comments.text: Basically... american built cars are sold in USA. Not elsewhere. While Euro cars﻿ sell in every country. I just drove a few weeks ago from England down to Crete. Thats through most of Europe. Through 6 countries and back. I saw 3 GMs 2 of them were korean built. How far can you walk down the road anywhere in USA without seeing a european car? Just around the corner I bet. Infact the 10 most popular cars in USA this month, top6 were japanese then 2 European Fords and then 2 american trucks.

comments.text:
When I first drove a car , I drove a 92 Chevy Caprice.
And then my dad bought a 2002 chevy Caprice, and we used it.
And then we " as a family " bought 2005 GMC Yukon XL.
In 2009 , we bought a Chevy Tahoe.When I got my first Car, It was a 2011 Malibu. I left my country, and I'm looking for a car right now.  - I went to the dealer, he﻿ told me that I should get the toyota camry. It's reliable and hold it's retail price, He said.
I told him nothing is " worth " driving like GM. GIVE ME THE IMPALA!.

comments.text: I can't quite put my finger on it. It may be the intense music, my love for the brand, or the bitter sweetness of what all GM lost and has gained since bankcruptcy.
